# Introduction

I want Orbital to be a safe and productive work space for everyone here, including myself.

To do this as an independent business, we operate under some constraints:

We can't solve problems through spending more money.

  • There's a limit to what we can offer and support.
  • Instead, we rely on trust.

We don't have full-time staff.

  • Minimizing the number of times the buzzer rings, because it's an interruption everytime, regardless of whether someone.
  • I need to know that when I'm not physically present that problems aren't going to arise.

We have to make the space we have work for everyone.

  • Growing the membership slowly and making sure people aren't competing for resources.
  • Utilizing the full space, so that we can minimize contention in the space.

# Getting Started

  1. Read and agree to our Code of Conduct the House Rules.

  2. Add yourself to the member directory and homepage

  3. If you’d like a cubby on FL3 for your personal belongings contact Gary.

  4. Watch this video so you know how to properly plunge toilets.

  5. We rely on Google Groups for email announcements and to provide access control to members-only resources (like the spreadsheet above and conference rooms). If there’s a different Google email address you’d like to use, email Gary and let him know.

  • Setup Slack.

    • If you belong to more than one active Slack, install the Mac or Windows Desktop client, as well as the Mobile Apps.

    • Customize as necessary. (also see: How I Set Up Slack for Maximum Zen and Sidebar Tips.

    • Mute everything except #155, which contains messages relevant to those in the space (free food in the kitchen, visiting guests, lost and found), especially if the Orbital Slack is your secondary or tertiary Slack.

    • Add a profile photo with your actual face so that folks know what you look like.

# House Rules

  1. Everyone is expected to abide by our Code of Conduct, whether they interact online or in-person.

  2. Content posted on Slack is private unless they're in #jobs or #please-retweet. Don't repost anything publicly unless you have permission. We operate Slack under Chatham House Rule:

Participants are free to use the information received, but neither the identity nor the affiliation of the speaker(s), nor that of any other participant, may be revealed.

  1. Bathrooms are all-gender. (Dudes: please put the toilet seat down when you are finished.)

  2. Bring your used cups and dishes (and those of your guests) down to the FL2 dishwasher. If you use a dish from EA1’s dishrack on FL4, wash it when you’re done.

  3. 155 Rivington is an old building, so things will break. When they do, post in #155 so that others know what to avoid (or message Gary on Slack).

  4. If you’re the last one out, you’re responsible for closing up. Instructions are here.

  5. Orbital is a pet-free space; exceptions are made for service dogs.

  6. Please remember to close the door as you enter/exit each floor as it helps particularly in the Winter and Summer.

Last Updated: 8/18/2019, 1:09:03 PM
